title.narrative: Smart Solutions for traffic in Lima, Peru

description.narrative: The Dutch Embassy in Lima has a long track record of engagement in Sustainable Cities, of which Sustainable Mobility is a core axis. The most important theme of Sustainable Mobility for the Embassy’s action is bicycle promotion as anchor and pavement for Sustainable Mobility related opportunities.The Embassy’s track record in this subject includes organizing a yearly bicycle event, attended by 4,800 guests last year, stimulating bicycle use through offering cost-benefit analyses to employers, and presenting potential improvements in Lima’s mobility at different platforms. For 2019, the Dutch embassy in Lima will focus on Smart Solutions for traffic in metropolitan areas in Peru.Context: Economic losses for local private sector due to enormous traffic jam in the capital. The economic costs of Lima’s congestion is estimated between 8 till 10 Billion USD per year, accounting for almost 5% of Peru’s GDP. The urbanisation rate in Lima remains high, resulting in an estimated growth of the city of 2% per year, and economic growth is also projected for the next coming year, to combination of which is very likely to result in even more traffic congestion than today if no decisive action is taken soon. This decisive action should partly be increasing bicycle use. Research for the embassy in Peru has shown that about 30% of Peruvian employees work at biking distance of their home, which is less than 7 km/h.The combination of these facts, together with the physical characteristics of Lima: it is a relatively flat city with very little rain per year, a moderate climate, makes promoting the bicycle possibly the best solution to Lima’s traffic problems.Lima has set a couple of steps in the right direction considering the stimulation of bicycle transport. Bicycle paths are being constructed, the new bicycle law just past parliament, and bicycle renting places are arising. There are also more smart initiatives rising up in terms of electrical transport, a example is Movo (electric transport), part of Cabify. The bicycle revolution is far from completed. Potential cyclist name traffic safety, largely because of bad infrastructure and non-compliance with traffic rules, as prime reason not to use the bicycle, with as other mayor issue the lack of auxiliary infrastructure, like bike parking spots and showers at work. Bicycle paths are not standardized either, and the sub municipalities are each responsible for their own cycle paths, resulting in many cycle paths ending where the sub municipality’s border ends, instead of being an connected, city-wide network.Jorge Muñoz, the ex-mayor of Lima’s sub-district where the embassy is located, has recently been elected as mayor of the entire city of Lima, with reducing traffic congestion as one of his spear points. At the same time, the World bank is about to start a project in Lima to construct 12,500 km of bicycle paths. The combination of these steps towards more bicycle transport in Lima call for stepping up the Dutch efforts as well, in order for our country to remain influential and in this way keep its position to contribute to less traffic congestion, hence less economic loss and improved quality of life for the inhabitants of Lima. Sustainable Transport promotion is in line with the Embassy’s yearly plan as is the “vehicle” bicycle use since it not only contributes directly to the Peruvian local Economy but also stimulates Dutch investment in the Sustainable Development / Urban planning possibilities which are present in Lima.

participating-org.narrative: Ambassade van het Koninkrijk der Nederlanden in Lima (Peru)

title.narrative: Number of people directly reached - Local

comment.narrative: Sustainable Mobility week (and Cycle event) in Lima takes place in April 2019. The Embassy’s track record in this subject includes organizing a yearly bicycle event, attended by 4800 guests last year, stimulating bicycle use through offering cost-benefit analyses to employers, and presenting potential improvements in Lima’s mobility at different platforms.

Results:
Pre-bicicleteada • Professional promotional videos of car vs. bike + why we cycle in Lima, including points of improvement for infrastructure
Bicicleteada • Multi Sectoral Awareness Creating (MSAC) by means event for bicycle use, including lasting shirts promoting bicycle use • National press coverage of bicycle stimulation and the Netherlands as bicycle country. The president of Peru, Mr,. Marytin Vizcarra Cornejo, joined ambassador Wiebe de Boer to lead the cycling group. • Increased attention for the employer bicycle stimulation cost-benefit analysis, a concrete and free stimulation tool. • Different presentations increasing awareness of cycling as traffic congestion solution • Expo + Roundtable with 15 municipalities od Metropolitan Lima.
Post-Bicicleteada • Letter of intent for increased bicycle promotion and cooperation between all mayors of Lima, as well as the municipality of Eindhoven • Letter of intent between the embassy and the ministry of education about bicycle and traffic training at schools

title.narrative: Description of changes achieved in laws, regulations, policy plans, outcomes of social dialogue or development strategies enacted or adopted by local government or social dialogue partners, yielding tangible benefits to the business climate

comment.narrative: Letter of intent for increased bicycle promotion and cooperation between all mayors of Lima, as well as the municipality of Eindhoven Letter of intent between the embassy and the ministry of education about bicycle and traffic training at schools
